website_summaries.verdict: A small, inexpensive cooler that is well-constructed and provides good insulation.
cons: Occasional issues with the interior hard liner cracking

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, make sure you understand the sizing.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made cooler, and keeps things reasonably cold. Do make sure you understand the sizing. "16-Can" isn't anywhere near as big as it sounds. I usually put a single 6-pack of bottles in, with enough ice to keep things cool - and there's enough room on top for a smallish bag of chips or a sandwich.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Lunch.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Not too big or too small. See attached photos. Wife and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler, affordable & well-insulated.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: (Blue 16-can cooler) - well insulated with padded nylon outside & a semi-soft plastic holder inside (easy to carry out the drinks too) - extra zipper pockets to utilize extra space inside and out - 1 front zipped pocket (outside) - 2 mesh side-pockets (outside) - 1 mesh pocket on top (inside) - durable carrying strap & adjustable - top bungee cord for securing extra bottled-drink - easy to clean - workmanship looks decent - more affordable than other brand (less than 20), Walmxxt may be 1 to 2 bucks more. Cons: - it's tight for 16 cans of soda, almost leave no room for cooler-ice-packs, so prepare to get a small/slim ice-packs or carry less items
customer_reviews.author: linghk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work and the pool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the purpose of a lunch box and cooler to bring by the pool/go fishing. It's perfect for both. My food for the day fits perfectly with the hard liner taken out. 6 beers with plenty of ice and s sandwich fit with the hard liner in.
customer_reviews.author: Farand C. Wasiak

customer_reviews.title: I really like the separate hard plastic liner that comes with it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a road trip and it worked well for our needs. For a party of two it held enough snacks and drinks. I was really surprised at the amount of drinks it could hold (please see pic). I really like the separate hard plastic liner that comes with it. It made cleaning and trips to the ice machine easier. The portable size and shoulder strap make transporting it to in our car and carrying it to the room extremely convenient. I'm considering getting a couple more as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2
customer_reviews.text: perfect size for 2 people! able to fit ice packs drinks and snacks! was a bit more true green than the olive green it looked like in the photo but that doesn't really matter to us!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very spacious, but wish it had a dedicated handle on top!
customer_reviews.text: It feels much larger than my previous 16 can MaxCold but that may be due to the orientation of the space. I tend to use my "cooler/lunch box" like a man-purse (because come on that's basically what it is) and one of my favorite things about the MaxCold was the separate top portion. I could keep potentially sweaty or spillable items up there when I had something like an expensive electronic in the bottom portion! I love the removable liner but wish it had a dedicated handle on top. You can kind of grab the two bungie cables but not sure how well that would hold while heavy. Feels pretty nice, hoping it lasts a while!
customer_reviews.author: Helifano

customer_reviews.title: A 'cool' bag
customer_reviews.text: I really like the coleman cooler bags. I had the same bag in a smaller size before I lost it and ended up purchasing this one for the bigger size. Quality is good, has mesh netting on the sides and inside upper part of bag for extra storage. Keeps food/drinks nice and cold for a good couple of hours. If you're actually putting ice in the bag, beware of melting ice water, which may leak from the zipper seams if you're shoulder carrying this bag and tipping it side to side. Only minor complaint is that I wished the shoulder straps can be longer, otherwise this is a great bag for a car trip, beach, camping etc.
customer_reviews.author: L&W

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and works well enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an Arctic Zone cooler that I purchased years ago and whose zipper just gave out. This Coleman was cheap enough and looks nice. The cooler walls and top are pretty thin honestly so I don’t know how long this would keep things cool. I tend to use it to haul my lunch and pumped breast milk to and from work, with lots of ice packs. It definitely keeps those items cold with that setup and my hour commute. This cooler is shaped more like a rectangle than a square, so it might be challenging to fit some hard-sided lunch containers without removing the hard cooler liner. So far that hasn’t been a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley Brannan

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Just used this cooler on a road trip and when the ice melted in cooler it leaked all over the back of our car. My return window is closed so I guess I'm stuck with it. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler for first responders, could use better insulation
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this continuously for 3 months since purchasing it for my EMT job. It's pretty spacious and can comfortably fit 3 meals, snacks, and a drink. I use this with 3 different ice packs and it does a pretty good job. It's fairly rugged, but there are some stitching issues and it seems the zipper could be better quality. Overall it's pretty decent. My only gripe is the insulation could be a bit better despite having the entire thing being filled with ice packs.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Wazlib

customer_reviews.title: replacement
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job, the elastic pockets on the ends are so tight you can barely get anything in them. Guess it won't fall out. I only gave it 4 stars because you can't get 3 cans in a row. It is just barely deep enough to get my plastic ware in the bottom. does a good job of keeping my lunch cool. a lot of arrainging every time you take something out or need to put something in.
customer_reviews.author: Terry L. Favor

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 6pk of bottles nicely
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cooler that would fit beer bottles instead of cans. You can place a 6pk right on top perfectly or lay them down and fit other items. Because ice melts fairly quickly in the Florida heat and this cooler's insulation is minimal, I fill the plastic insert with water about 2-3 inches, freeze it, then place my items in the cooler. It takes the ice longer to melt, and I can always add more on top or ice packs. Of course, once the ice melts, if the cooler tips, it will leak, because after all - it's made of cloth.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineWitch

customer_reviews.title: Great for kayaking
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for for kayaking. I can hold a snack/lunch/drink with an ice pack, and the outside pockets let me stash little things like phone, sunscreen, bandana, etc. Unlike a soft bag, this has enough structure to stand up and not send everything rolling around the boat. Plus, I can use it like a "foot peg" to brace my feet against (my yak's feet things are missing). Most of the structure is provided by a hard plastic insert, which is great - it can be rigid or squishy, as you need.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Coleman cooler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my old one leaked and unfortunately this one does too. Not out the bottom so thats good, but make sure you don’t bend over with it on your shoulder because it will pour out the top zipper area. Otherwise its really nice... has a pocket in the lid, side pockets, front zipper pocket. Theres also a removable plastic insert you can use if you need to cooler lining to be more rigid. I still use it all the time but note water does come out the top if you tilt or knock over the cooler... well mine does anyway.
customer_reviews.author: JAL21

customer_reviews.title: Takes a beating!
customer_reviews.text: This is what my husband uses for a lunch box. He is notoriously hard on things. The removable stiff liner was key for him and the main reason we chose this container. It’s holding up marvelously! Cleans up and airs out well so it doesn’t get stinky, keeps items cool for hours and hours. His only complaint is he wishes the net holders on the sides were a little bigger. He can’t really put anything in them without fear of tearing them. We waited to review until he lived with this for a bit to try to give a real review.
customer_reviews.author: Shae

customer_reviews.title: What a DEAL!!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a little cooler for my husband. This one is perfect!! Small enough to take anywhere and roomy enough to hold 8 bottles of water and a sandwich & small snack. The inside has a durable plastic insert to help keep it's shape and also wipe clean ~ love it. Outside pocket for condiments or napkins. We have used this baby over... and over... and over and it still looks new. Honestly ~ best little cooler we've ever purchased. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous cooler that I bought at Target which fell to pieces pretty quickly because the material on the outside was cheap (it started to shred and then got caught in the zipper and well after that things just went to heck). This Coleman cooler has a nice sturdy, shiny material on the outside and a handy little pocket in the front (for storing other items that don't necessarily need to be kept cold like utensils). The liner inside is also very sturdy and easily removable for cleaning. I am very satisfied with my purchase and am even considering getting the larger size of the cooler for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Not was expected
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet. But its teeny tiny. We are camping and needed something in the heat of AZ to keep drinks cold.No way does this fit 16 cans! It fits SIX 20 oz. bottles and thats it! For $30 bucks I expected something that fit 16 cans!
customer_reviews.author: Luvmy5gkids

customer_reviews.title: Perfect day cooler for two!  READ this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size easy carry cooler for my husband & I to take to the pool for the day. Fits four cans of soda or water bottles, plus ice & sandwiches & snacks. With room to spare. Doesn’t leak. Keeps everything nice & cold for hours. There’s a little pocket on the front for your cellphone & small nets on either side of the exterior for your keys & sunscreen. Even holds an unopened bottle of wine if you lean it a little sideways. Just the perfect size for two people for the day. There are bingeing straps on the very top to hold silverware & napkins. It works for us!
customer_reviews.author: McSusie

customer_reviews.title: it's fine
customer_reviews.text: It arrived yesterday and the zipper is already having problems with closing/opening. Partly because whoever closed it last, closed it with the sticky tag from the inside jammed in the zipper track. Also, a long giant black thread was dangling from the bottom of it. I feel like it's already had some use but I ordered it brand new. I took lunch, 2 string cheeses, and 2 cans of flavored water today with some ice packs. Lunch was still cool when I took it out after 5 hours. Drink is still cool, been in there almost 7 hours.
customer_reviews.author: againstthewind

customer_reviews.title: Nice cooler. Look at dimensions when you buy.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it yet so can only say it appears durable and I depend on the Coleman name to live up to expectations. Item appears well constructed. It is somewhat smaller than expected; but I should have taken a closer look at dimensions. It will serve my needs as a personal small picnic/car cooler. I will update when I’ve had the chance to use. Love the military green color!
customer_reviews.author: Molly.M

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Like the cooler. Used for about a month for work but did decide to get the 9 cab size instead because this one can take up space inside the heavy equipment I run. Also with the extra space tend to pack more than I need making it get quite heavy.
customer_reviews.author: LBwis

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for growler and cold six-pack transport.
customer_reviews.text: Too big for a lunchbox but too small for a cooler, this is still a nice option when I want to transport a small amount of cold beer. It will easily hold eight bottles (cans? LOL!) with one ice pack in the netting inside the lid or a six-pack if more ice packs are needed along the sides. It also will fit a standard half-gallon growler (and two or three ice packs), which often comes in handy. It won't keep things as cold for as long as a proper "hardside" cooler, but I can sling this over my shoulder and carry a lot of other things at the same time, something I can't do with a plastic cooler.
customer_reviews.author: George from Louisville

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler. I had the smaller version but needed a little more room. Just wish it had a bigger water bottle pocket. I’m kind of picky about things and this satisfies me. I use this daily for my lunches. One sandwich in container, yogurt, banana, small bag of chips, apple, little nuts and cheese container, three bottles of water and two thin profile ice packs. I also strap a 30 oz water bottle to the top. It’s not that secure but it usually makes it to the truck.
customer_reviews.author: bryan Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and keeps drinks cold!
customer_reviews.text: I love that the hard plastic liner is removable. It makes things so much easier to clean. We stuffed this full of drinks for our road trip and it kept them nice and cold for a while. We do the same thing when we go fishing and it works great as long as you keep it out of too much direct sunlight. I imagine it would work well as a large lunch box as well. There's plenty of room for drinks and ice or ice packs, but we have never used it without the liner so I don't know if it would leak water. I wouldn't suggest using it without the liner unless you're using ice packs.
customer_reviews.author: Pieceofcandi

customer_reviews.title: Had this a couple of years now
customer_reviews.text: This little cooler is my daily lunchbox and I use it seven days a week. Weekdays for work and weekends for cool refreshing beverages. It is very sturdy and durable. The only downside which is true with most soft side coolers is the limited lifetime of the ice, but that it pretty minor in the big picture. I will order again if and when this one falls apart.
customer_reviews.author: WII player60

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for Father’s Day !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Father’s Day gift and it was a hit ! My partner works outside in the heat so he would benefit from having cold drinks throughout his shift. The cooler is big enough to hold his lunch and have a few cold drinks to keep him cool throughout his shift. He was super happy about his gift ! It’s very sturdy and lightweight and it keeps things cold for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca R.

customer_reviews.title: Coleman product fan here from pakistan!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the product! Had my uncle deliver it to me all the way from US to pakistan because of the wonderful reviews this product had. But not to be! It leaks water once the ice melts and the ice did not even stay for a few hours time. The thread lining is coming off already only after the first use. I can't even return this now! TERRIBLE PRODUCT, NOT RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Rabbani Khan

customer_reviews.title: This is the best box you will love.
customer_reviews.text: They tell you it has a plastic removable liner which it dose, but they don't tell you its a hard plastic liner which is great to keep clean or pull out and put in the dishwasher. Ton of room for everything for lunch.Sandwhiches,drinks and snacks. Just add ice coolers and all good. Even if you leave it in your car, for long periods, which I do cause I go to work at 1am,and don't eat lunch until 10Am.Food is all good.Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Holds up very well after years of use!
customer_reviews.text: I can't remember how long ago I received this product, but guessing over a year ago. I love it! Very practical to take lunch to work. Its big enough to include large ice packs along with food and beverage. The product is holding up very well with daily use, both the mechanisms and material. The hard plastic inner liner is easily removed for cleanup. It also gives the bag nice structure to prevent food from being crushed. If I ever need another one, I'll definitely buy same product!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria M Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for a hard working hubby
customer_reviews.text: My husband works at an intermodal facility and it's really tough, dirty work. He had the smaller version for a few years and needed something bigger. This is the only lunch box that can withstand the diesal and wear he puts on everything. The insert makes it super easy to clean and no matter how he throws it around, it doesn't show it, and keeps his lunch cold.
customer_reviews.author: Mehgan

customer_reviews.title: durable and roomy
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed a replacement cooler, to hold his lunch items for work. This looked like a good product, so I ordered it in green. turns out, my husband loves it! He is able to fit his lunch items in the cooler without having to remove the liner. There is plenty of room and he has even attached a few items to the "lid", using the bungy cords to secure the items. I highly recommend this cooler
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong for the price
customer_reviews.text: this thing is great. I use it in the saddlebag of my Roadglide. Of course the ice eventually melts but it's directly above the exhaust. The removable plastic interior is great for cleaning it. It's a cheap little cooler, not a $100 double walled one. Buy it if you don't want to spend a bunch but want to keep some stuff cold for a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use primarily as a "lunchbox" and to keep drinks and snacks cold on roadtrips with my family. Works well. Keeps cold things cold for a long time. Interior plastic shell is easy to clean and prevents crushing. Exterior pockets are great and so are the stretchy cords that can hold a large Thermos or other vacuum bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a golf trip / bachelor party, and these quickly became the crucial part of equipment that every golf outing should have: - they fit perfectly in the back cubby of ANY golf cart. Seriously, we haven't found a golf cart yet where they don't fit - the keep ice (and the drinks) cold for a whole round. Yes it melts a little, but it still has great thermal protection - Fits up to 16 beers, no problem and ice - straps and connections are solid, so no worries about this thing breaking any time soon (especially loaded down with 16 beers)
customer_reviews.author: KDG.One

customer_reviews.title: this is the BEST cooler ever
customer_reviews.text: this is the BEST cooler ever, no joke. I love that you can use the removable liner separately. we took it on our trip and used the liner for the pantry-type snacks, and used the cooler for cold drinks and snacks. kept everything cool for a 9 hour road trip! I just dont like the handles on the removable liner because they are so "sharp". I wrapped tape around them so i could carry it without feeling like it's going to cut my fingers off. Maybe if they added some padding or something around the handles, that would be great. but simple fix for me so i dont mind, worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: The strap is a great design but we don't use it to hang of ...
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought the 9 can cooler, but found it was not big enough for our needs. The material is tough and waterproof. The strap is a great design but we don't use it to hang of our shoulders because we use this item as a lunch box. It keeps the cold items cold and I love the design and color! Highly recommended. I hope that you have found my opinion to be helpful with your decision process to purchase this item. If this is the case, and where Amazon asks if this review helpful, please click "yes". Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mary B.

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The Coleman 16 can cooler was smaller than expected so it was returned. I ordered the 32 can size Coleman cooler from a different retailer and it was perfect. The 32 can size was able to hold 9 (33.8 ounces) bottles of water in the upright position. Frozen bottles of water lasted up to three days in the refrigerator in the cooler while working out of town. I am sure the 16 can size would be good for those who want a smaller cooler but I chose the one with the most room.
customer_reviews.author: JessDee

customer_reviews.title: Great for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband. It is perfect size for lunch and extras (drinks, keys, etc.) it also has a strap with shoulder pad which will make it easier for him to carry his tool box. There is a zipper in the front, great size pocket. On the top there is bungee cord straps to hold down more extras. It just perfect all around. I highly recommend. Also, the inside has that hard plastic insert, wonderful and very convient.
customer_reviews.author: Warnali

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lightweight cooler for all around use!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooler without the plastic insert fit over 9 bottles of water and a couple of food items on top. (packed with 2 bag of ice jell) stayed cool for over 13 hrs. with temp in the 95+ S.Calif . actually could fit several more bottle water if needed, Highly recommed this coleman cooler; lightweight easy for travel, transport etc., .
customer_reviews.author: Careful Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat it for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Better size and more useful than other 12- or 16-can models. Plastic liner far superior to one without, making others far more likely to leak. Of course, if you are packing ice, and turn this unit on it’s side, it will leak since the seal is a zipper. But that zipper is better than velcro or a folding flap, like most others in this size and price range. Can’t beat it for the cost, and I liked this one enough so I bought a 9-can also.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: This cooler fits 6 bottles of water and ice packs with room to spare. My Kindle fits perfect in the front pocket. I really like the plastic liner inside the cooler. It's easy to clean and it keeps the cooler from leaking. It's exactly what I was looking for. Works perfect for work or for outings. I like the elastic cords on top. I slip my magazines under it and that's just less to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Monty

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I can easily fit a large Tupperware full of salad, and ice pack or frozen water bottle, a smaller Tupperware with a sandwich, and a couple of drinks. I'm a contractor and I try to bring my food to work with me so I don't end up eating fast food everyday, and this has kept my food and drinks very cold thus far. The true test will come when Texas summer hits, if it does not perform to this level in the heat, I will try to post an update.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for Disneyland & beach trips
customer_reviews.text: Great little cooler! It actually fits quite a lot for a day trip. We have taken it to Disneyland for 2 days and to the beach. It's very well insulated and I love the removable insert. It make it handy for cleaning and keeping the shape of the cooler sturdy. We packed 6 sodas and a few kids juice pouches, 2 sandwiches & uncrustable, string cheese, Apple and cucumbers and some treats with a very thin ice pack on the side. Fit perfectly snug and kept everything nice and cool in hot weather. Def worth it and I thought the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: MakeupartistJen22

customer_reviews.title: Great storage, acceptable portability
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is surprisingly deep and stores a lot. I use it daily as a lunch box. The zipper is smooth. The front pocket holds some accessories. I've found that most food storage containers store best with the lip (not the lid!) on the top of the interior plastic bin instead of trying to tilt them to fit inside. Any leaks are easily cleaned out. Food stays cold for quite a while. The strap is a little awkward for carrying - it's too short for the shoulder and too long for the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Antonov

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Solid Unit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooler as a dual purpose unit. I needed a new lunch box, but wanted something that functioned as a solid cooler for a day trip kayaking. 5 stars as a lunch box, a solid 3.5-4 stars as a day trip kayak cooler. At first glance, this cooler seems like it would hold a little more than it does. It fits the amount of space I have available on my kayak, but doesn’t quite fit as much contents including the ice packs as I’d like. Regardless, it’s a solid cooler. The inner plastic liner is pretty sturdy and it keeps stuff cool all day if there is minimal opening.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Great lunch box/cooler. Not leak proof. Be careful of the zipper.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Honestly is one of the best lunch box/coolers I've had. HOWEVER, I can't support the claims that it is leak proof. If tipped, water will most certainly leak from the zipper. Otherwise it can be said to be "leak proof." I do also think the shoulder strap is quite short. I've also noticed quite a bit of wear at the corners of the insulation material where the zipper passes.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: I will defy you to get 15 12oz cans and ...
customer_reviews.text: I will defy you to get 15 12oz cans and even a cup full of ice in this cooler. Money grab using the Coleman name. I am contacting Amazon to see how much hassle is involved in returning this. TINY....
customer_reviews.author: J. Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Good lunch cooler
customer_reviews.text: I just upgraded from a 9 can to a 16 can so I can carry more water to work (trying to avoid fountains with the whole pandemic thing...). If it's as good as my old I'll be happy. I once had a water bottle leak and all of it stayed in the bag and I never used the plastic liner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This should be called a  " 12 Cans and Ice " cooler
customer_reviews.text: Purchased cooler for 12 hour work day lunches. Should have found this cooler and physically inspected before buying. Interior is narrow but tall. Can't lay 2 Gatorade bottles side by side with plastic liner installed. Tried to put a 12 oz. can in the outside mesh pocket. Material started to rip away from the plastic piping at the top of the pocket. Front exterior zippered pouch already lost 4 of its plastic zipper teeth. Wouldn't recommend this cooler for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Delaware Glider

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy cooler
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is absolutely fantastic. The fact that it has a removable liner is super convenient. No more having to wash out a interior of a cloth cooler. And I bought the four ice packs to go along with this. Everything stays cold all day long. This was an excellent purchase. Would definitely buy again. Quality is superb. Love the adjustable strap. And it holds a lot of food. I bring both breakfast and lunch with me, along with a morning snack and an afternoon snack. I don't use our refrigerator at work because it's always filthy and nobody cleans up after themselves. So this is the perfect substitute!
customer_reviews.author: LNJ

customer_reviews.title: Best investment for a working guy.
customer_reviews.text: Hate dragging around hard coolers to work every day. But every lunch bag was either too small, too flimsy, too expensive (like a $85 "meal management system." Which is just a marketing gimmick for people trying to lose weight by splitting their lunch into multiple containers) I needed a bag that not only had room for two meals, drinks, and a few snacks for 12-16 hour days, but had pockets to also hold my wallet, glasses case, phone charger and whatever else was plaguing my pockets. This lunch bag does all that. Stays cold for my entire day with even just two small soft ice packs. And the hard removable insert keeps the whole thing rigid and my lunch safe.
customer_reviews.author: Sobertese

customer_reviews.title: Brittle plastic liner.
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly what I was looking for... until it broke the 2nd time I used it. Admittedly, I dropped it... but it didn’t fall far (3-4 feet?) and it didn’t have much weight in it (an ice pack, some lunch meat, and some cheese.) Now the plastic liner has a huge crack along the bottom. I generally use this in the car, and don’t want melted ice leaking onto my seats... so this is now basically trash. I ordered this to replace a generic version I had previously bought at Wally World, had for years, but lost in a move. I would have thought a brand name would be better quality. Apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel J

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for a lot of snacks and lunch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a little cooler to keep small batches of this cold in case I lost power in an expective storm that did not come. I've used it for lunch, also. Great bag, durable insert. Lots of pockets for goodies. Paired with a frozen water bottle and a metal spork you're good to go! It will also hold over a 6 pack of bevs.
customer_reviews.author: Zehavi Bat-Sheva

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold Ice Well
customer_reviews.text: This does not hold ice for a long time. Maybe a short afternoon at best, but certainly not 24 hours as it claims. Even used 5 high quality ice packs, the most it can hold, and it still does not keep it cold for 24 hours. It's only good for short picnic trips.
customer_reviews.author: Navid Y.

customer_reviews.title: jacked up zipper
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this just based on the price. I guess I might received a defective one. The zipper is always getting caught around the corners, so much so that it keeps snagging the inside lining. There are small tears in it now, zipper and lid quality = garbage.
customer_reviews.author: marie

customer_reviews.title: Not as well insulated as I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I am a little disappointed at the thickness of the insulation. When you put ice packs in this cooler, you can feel the cold through all the material on the outside of the material, which means it isn’t keeping the cold inside. My no-name lunch box keeps food cold longer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Lunch box!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a fantastic lunch box so far! lots of space, and keeps cold for most of the day with 2 smaller ice packs. I love the plastic insert, if I have leaky containers or something liquid in it like soup, and it spills, the clean up is SO easy! The ONLY downside: the shoulder strap slips off your shoulder really easily, and is not very long. I'm thinking about sewing on some non-slip drawer liner stuff, or something similar to the bottom of the pad, with fishing line.
customer_reviews.author: punkred13

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this, I had initially bought a smaller version of this but working 16 hour shifts didn’t give me enough storage for my breast milk. So, I use this for my double shifts and the smaller one for my single shifts. Great product! Would definitely recommend- well made and durable. When I’m done breast feeding, I will definitely use this as my lunch box for meal preps.
customer_reviews.author: hD

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: It is a great size for what I need, and the food stays cold when I include a cold pack. I had this in the car all day, and the food and the ice pack were still cold. The other good thing, it isn't heavy and I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Retiree

customer_reviews.title: Zipper gets stuck on corners
customer_reviews.text: This was going to be one of my dad's Christmas presents. While preparing to wrap it, I tested out the zipper and noticed it consistently got stuck on the interior corners causing tears in the insulation, so much for that gift! Now I'm in the process of trying to find a replacement right before Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: JCo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Item
customer_reviews.text: It holds a good amount of food, keeping it cold. However, I expected the ice pack to stay a little more solid, as per the description, and keep food cold for a long day at work. Also disappointed that this Coleman product isn't made in the US.
customer_reviews.author: relenta3

customer_reviews.title: Great little cooler
customer_reviews.text: I really love this cooler. This is a replacement for the exact cooler that was stolen off the back of my truck. Although it is listed as a 12 can cooler, this cooler is perfect for 8 longneck beers and plenty of ice. A great little cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Camping and Fishing
customer_reviews.text: This little cooler is perfect for a few beers and a light lunch for camping or a day trip fishing. There is a plastic insert that comes out that can allow for more odd shaped objects. We could easily fit 12 cans of beer in this cooler. There is also a bungee cord on the top that can hold other things that do not need to be chilled or kept warm.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Eastridge

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This 16-can cooler is the perfect size for me to keep in vehicle M-F. I needed something to keep my daily lunch bag w/ freezer pack and iced water chilled until lunchtime - this fits the bill perfectly, and, for less than $15, I'm very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Love this cooler
customer_reviews.text: I take this cooler with me to work every day for my drinks with 2 of them thicker ice packs in it and a couple drinks and my stuff stays cold all day (6-8hrs a day in direct sunlight out in my vehicle) so I'd have to say it is by far the best cooler I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.author: A.moy6911

customer_reviews.title: For a few bucks more you could have an awesome cooler
customer_reviews.text: I really love this cooler for a number of reasons, the first being that it's got an internal "bucket" that is removable for washing spills. This little cooler fits my tallest water bottles. The side pocket is nice for adding cutlery and such.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price point
customer_reviews.text: Great low cost cooler. There is nothing that Coleman could do to improve on the design of this cooler or the other two sizes in their family of coolers. It is priced at a point that does not hurt if you discard it when it gets dirty. It keeps this cold but not as cold as some of the high dollar coolers like the Yeti or coolers with extra thick insulation. I do not forsee any problems with straps or zipper durability for the practical life of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Walter McKinley

customer_reviews.title: No leaks, very well insulated
customer_reviews.text: I had tried 3 similar sized coolers without an inner hard shell and each leaked by the 3-4 usage. I’ve used this cooler 7 times now and it’s a lightweight, sturdy, and very well insulated personal cooler. I was pleasantly surprised at how long the ice held up on a mid 80’s sunny day out on the boat. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Miller-Mission

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I wish the front pocket was a little larger ..but all in all a great cooler. Also...all of the reviews talking about breaking the insert...I've bought the comparable Walmart brand coolers before and they always fall apart. The "flimsy" nature of this one makes it just flexible enough that it doesn't crumble every time you brush against something. I've cracked the Walmart brand ones time and time again, this one is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Mild111Top Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Great gift "basket"
customer_reviews.text: Great gift "basket". It's so challenging to buy for a man sometimes, but a fun gift basket is loved by everyone. I learned you can almost always make a man happy with a steak and something good to drink. I had fun stuffing this cooler with goodies for a man's gift at Christmas and it went over very well. There were pockets to hide little goodies in and after emptying the contents he had a really nice cooler to take on the road with him since he travels a lot. Great for boating, carrying goodies to cookouts as well as travel and it looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: bswand

customer_reviews.title: Strap sewn on twisted
customer_reviews.text: This cooler was delivered with the straps sewn on crooked and twisted and I can't untwist... This was a gift for Christmas and I missed it by two days what a rip off
customer_reviews.author: AnneB

customer_reviews.title: Other than that the unit is very nice and leaks stay contained inside
customer_reviews.text: Bungee strap on top broke after the 2nd use. Other than that the unit is very nice and leaks stay contained inside!!
customer_reviews.author: Susanne M. Draper

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it every week. It doesn't line up properly when trying to use the zipper. The plastic around the inside where the zipper comes together, gets caught in the zipper. There are holes now in the area where the zipper comes together.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Plotnick

customer_reviews.title: Just ok, keeps drinks cool for a while but hard liner is too thin.  No liner in lid and cooler can leak if tipped.
customer_reviews.text: The hard liner is pretty thin and the lid doesn't have a plastic liner inside so you have to make sure not to tip this over or melted ice will spill out. It is not a zipperless, airlock system like other similar coolers. If the item's description photos actually showed the inside of the cooler, I would have never bought it.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: Overall great value great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Awesome cooler keeps things cold love the removable hard plastic insert so easy to clean. Great size about twice the size of a normal lunch bag which is great to bring my 3-4 bottles of water for my day and still get with my lunch. Only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is the strap does stay the way it should and I think eventually will break.
customer_reviews.author: deputyredhound

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually used it yet but I was just needing a small cooler. Sometimes when I grocery shop, I buy ice cream and other frozen products that I don't want to melt in the car on the way home. Occasionally, I stop at two grocery stores and buy frozen products and meat at both so this works well for keeping these items chilled or frozen until I get home.
customer_reviews.author: Volunteer

customer_reviews.title: Tall and leakproof
customer_reviews.text: Nice handy cooler with a nice front pocket to carry extras in. I like that is has a removable plastic “tub” inside so it doesn’t leak through and this size is nice for carrying bottles as well as cans as it is tall.
customer_reviews.author: BargainShopper

customer_reviews.title: Great for all day use, takes a beating. Needs a longer strap
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of space to hold lunch or dinner for two. I use 4 cold packs, and the cooler keeps things fresh for about half the day or more. Pocket on the side is great for utensils/ napkins. If you take out the included plastic bin, you can really stuff this thing. The only thing I don't like about this is the strap, it's not long enough to really carry over your shoulder comfortably, on me its like a purse. I would prefer a longer strap and maybe a carrying handle.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Might as well put your food or beverages in a shoe box! I put a full bag of ice in the cooler at 8pm and at 5am, it was all melted! This cooler is no more than a storage case! Should have known, get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, light-weight, just the right size
customer_reviews.text: I'm really satisfied with this purchase. I was looking for a smaller beach cooler for when we want to bring lunch and drinks. I've used a larger hard cooler for years and was looking for something lighter with a shoulder strap. I think for the price, this is a great buy. I like that you can remove the hard liner if you need more space. With the hard liner, I would say you can fit about 8 bottles or 10-12 cans, plus some other items like sandwich. The extra space at the top means you can fit some extra items in there which is a plus. Perfect for a day at the beach for two.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for work. Good price. Rugged.
customer_reviews.text: Actually got run over by a work truck and didn't break. Stays cool.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times since purchasing. It is a good size, sturdy, and durable. It doesn’t hold up to the Texas heat when using it outside with drinks in the middle of summer. However, I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: barnzy61

customer_reviews.title: A really nice Cooler bag.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality cooler bag. Perfect size for One person's fluid consuption for a LONG day at the beach, or two people for a 1/2 day visit. I use mine along with Four of my "Contigo Autoseal West Loop Stainless Steel Travel Mug with Open-Access Lid, 24-Ounce, Stainless Steel" and I sill have room for a big flat ice pack, and two more 12 ounce cans. Between the excelent Quality of this bag, as well as my Contigo insulated 24oz travel mugs, I leave for the beach at 8AM, and I still have ice cold drinks coming out of my cooler at 5PM on a 90 degree day in direct sunlight. Can you really ask for more than that?
customer_reviews.author: The Puzzle Maker

customer_reviews.title: Durable and flexible
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is big enough to pack just about anything you need for a day, for more than one person. It keeps food and drinks quite cool when using the removable ice bucket or without it and using just some ice packs on the bottom of the bag. Without the bucket, it's very flexible and can be squeezed into a duffel bag or back pack for a day at work. Very durable with an adjustable shoulder strap, pockets on the sides and in the front.
customer_reviews.author: T. Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: Keeps food cold for a longer period of time. Has a hard plastic liner to prevent any spills for leaking into the fabric outer case. Can fit under your seat when not in use. Have taken it to the Daytona 500 and it kept our food fresh and drinks cold for the whole day. I would recommend this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: At long last a long neck cooler.
customer_reviews.text: Great cooler. I make my own beer, so most of what I carry is 12 oz longnecks or even 22oz bottles. This cooler works perfect allowing the long necks to stand upright in the cooler so they don't get them all stirred up. I can even lay a bottle of wine for my wife in there as well. I have been very happy with the cooler. The solid plastic liner is a great feature to keep any water from leaking. If you need more flexibility, you can remove it and fit larger items int eh soft case.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Only write reviews for products that are poor relative to their reviews. Purpose for a cooler is to keep items cool. This product does not even when it is precooled before use. I have Colman cooler that perform well. This product is a waste of your money.
customer_reviews.author: ANK

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for the price and design
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I have used this soft sided type bag for years and always had the issue with ice melting and going through the material. Not anymore. With this plastic insert that stops that from happening. Just don't tip it over or lean over with it or the water will go everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: James Miles

customer_reviews.title: Light weight yet sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: One of my sons is based in 29 Palms. When he's got spare time he likes to do day-trips. This case is perfect for what he was looking for and about half the price as what the MX was charging for the identical item. I got it for him as a birthday gift and he loved it. Very sturdy, easy to clean the 'desert dust' that permeates everything there. He likes that he can strap it on his back if he's going hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Alto_Girl

customer_reviews.title: Take it everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: For someone who is always on the go.. this cooler is ESSENTIAL. I have taken it to work and school daily for the past 3 years and it keeps my food fresh and chilly. I can safely say this item will LAST me many more years to come. Fantastic little cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Volkov

customer_reviews.title: Another great product from coleman
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put on the front of my paddleboard to hold some drinks and snacks for the longer paddles. It works great. I bought some freezer ice to put in it and it keeps it cold just like it should. I would not hesitate to buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: N. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this cooler
customer_reviews.text: I coach a youth soccer team and this bag is perfect for bringing ice to use for players who get dinged up in the game (the cold packs you can buy that you pop and then shake to get cold are pretty useless in my opinion). The outer zipper pocket gives me a spot to keep zip lock bags, and the ice chest holds more than enough ice to fill up enough ice bags for the entire team (let's hope that won't ever be needed in a single game!). This cooler is very easy to carry with the comfortable shoulder strap and it is very lightweight, which is nice since I'm also carrying a bunch of other gear to games.
customer_reviews.author: T.H.O.

customer_reviews.title: I’d take a hard pass on this one.
customer_reviews.text: Nice sized cooler that can fit quite a bit. I think it would work better though if it could actually keep ANYTHING cool. There’s ZERO insulation in this thing whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: great line but thinner than I needed
customer_reviews.text: I really like the removable lining. But my salad Tupperware which is circular is too wide & had to put Tupperware on side which would then leak. As long as the Tupperware being put inside is less then 7 inches it is great
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Grike

customer_reviews.title: Bought for COVID-19 picnics
customer_reviews.text: Bought for COVID-19 picnics. Love the plastic insert, removable if you need more room. Use it to take drinks and other items to the river for picnics. Very sturdy, well-made, great price, you can pack more than you think. Very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine M. Shea

customer_reviews.title: My favorite beer cooler
customer_reviews.text: This one is my favorite beer cooler for my short picnic. I like it because of its size that I can bring it easily to anywhere and it works enough as a good cooler. One thing that I want to say is that the zipper on it is not water proof so the ice water in the bag can be flow through it when it’s leaned. Beside of it, everything is ok with this for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lee, Seung Hwan

customer_reviews.title: He LOVED it! It's a good size
customer_reviews.text: This lunch box was a gift for my husband for Christmas. He LOVED it! It's a good size. I was afraid it was too large but he says it's just right. In fact, as the weather warmed up and he started packing MORE water it's gotten a little cramped. The inside plastic "frame" is removable making it easy to wash. The front zipper pocket and inside lid mesh pocket are great additions that help keep things organized.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice cooler stylish durable for daily use
customer_reviews.text: Just like a cooler that I've had for over 12 years that has outlived its life this one makes all expectation and the removable liner if one of your drinks ever explode your legs very easy to pull it out rinse it out and be done move on I love the pocket on the top pouch to hide a ice bag very durable and a very nice cooler for daily use on the job site
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Coleman 16-Can Soft Cooler with Removable Liner
product_meta.description: The Coleman 16-Can Soft Cooler goes with you to picnics, BBQs, camping, sporting events, tailgates and beyond. It holds 16 cans inside, and features plenty of extra storage space in its front zippered pocket, side mesh pockets, and mesh pocket in the lid. There are even bungees on the lid for stowing more extras! Sporting an adjustable shoulder strap, the cooler is soft on the outside for comfortable carrying, and has a hard plastic liner inside to protect your food from being crushed. The liner material is FDA approved for food contact, and is removable for easy cleaning. The Soft Cooler provides antimicrobial protection, to resist odors, mold, and mildew.
feature_bullets: INSULATION: Main compartment keeps contents cold and prevents leaks with heat-welded seams
REMOVABLE LINER: Treated with antimicrobials to resist odor, mold, and fungus; use when packing with ice
CUSTOMIZED FIT: Shoulder straps are adjustable for maximum comfort
STORAGE OPTIONS: Front zippered pocket, side mesh pockets, dry storage pouch, and lid bungee for storing accessories

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
